content: Computer science has been used in biomedicine since the early 1960s, but it was only in the last few decades that it has become a prominent and essential tool in biomedical research. The development of powerful computers, advanced algorithms, and the availability of large amounts of biological data has enabled the creation of complex models and simulations that were not previously possible. Additionally, with the advancement of machine learning and artificial intelligence, computer science has opened up new possibilities for drug development, disease diagnosis, and personalized medicine. The use of computer science in biomedicine is constantly evolving and expanding, and it is expected to continue to play a critical role in biomedical research in the future.
